info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-mpls-ldp-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for MPLS LDP operational data.
     Copyright (c) 2017-2019, 2022 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** MPLS & TE
**Paths:** 5

**YANG Model:** [Cisco-IOS-XE-mpls-ldp-oper.yang](https://github.com/YangModels/yang/blob/main/vendor/cisco/xe/17181/Cisco-IOS-XE-mpls-ldp-oper.yang)

label.description:
Local label value
         0 - 0xfffff   : Valid local label range
         (0xfffff + 2) : No local label is allocated for this prefix

if-index.description: Interface index for link adjacency, 0 for targeted adjacency

flag.description: Flags (see: mpls ldp discovery adjacency flag)

hello-hold-time-adjacent.description: Adjacent hello hold time in seconds

hello-hold-time-negotiated.description: Negotiated hello hold time in seconds

hello-hold-time-remaining.description: Remaining hello hold time in seconds

password-source.description:
Password source values
         * 0       : neighbor
           This indicates that the password for the neighbor is retrieved
           from the mpls ldp neighbor [vrf vrf-name] ip-address password [0 | 7] password command.
         * 1~32767 : password option number
           This number defines the order in which the access lists are
           evaluated in the determination of a neighbor password.
         * 32768   : fall back to MD5 password for LDP sessions with peers
         * 32769   : none i.e, No password is configured for this neighbor

no-route.description: Flag: no route to transport address

no-host-route.description: Flag: no host route to transport address

hello-hold-time.description: Discovery hello hold time in seconds

negotiated.description: Negotiated session hold time in seconds

nsr-in-lbl-req-rec-created.description: Protocol state counter: NSR incoming label request record created

nsr-in-lbl-req-rec-freed.description: Protocol state counter: NSR incoming label request record freed

nsr-in-lbl-wd-rec-created.description: protocol state counter: NSR incoming label withdraw record created

nsr-in-lbl-wd-rec-freed.description: protocol state counter: NSR incoming label withdraw record freed

nsr-lcl-addr-wd-rec-created.description: Protocol state counter: NSR local address withdraw record created

nsr-lcl-addr-wd-rec-freed.description: Protocol state counter: NSR local address withdraw record freed

sess-ka-hold-time.description: Session keepalive hold time in seconds

negotiated.description: Negotiated session hold time in seconds

nsr-in-lbl-req-rec-created.description: Protocol state counter: NSR incoming label request record created

nsr-in-lbl-req-rec-freed.description: Protocol state counter: NSR incoming label request record freed

nsr-in-lbl-wd-rec-created.description: protocol state counter: NSR incoming label withdraw record created

nsr-in-lbl-wd-rec-freed.description: protocol state counter: NSR incoming label withdraw record freed

nsr-lcl-addr-wd-rec-created.description: Protocol state counter: NSR local address withdraw record created

nsr-lcl-addr-wd-rec-freed.description: Protocol state counter: NSR local address withdraw record freed

instance.description:
Instance Identifier
         * 0        : chassis-wide TDP Identifier
         * non-zero : Not chassis-wide TDP Identifier (i.e,for a ATM interface)

flags.description:
Flag value,
         0x01 : Request bindings marking
         0x02 : Request bindings update if a new LDP ID is being used
         0x04 : Request bindings deletion

listed.description:
Flag: New record created in GR down neighbor
         database

on-task-queue.description:
Flag: New record added to the GR down neighbor
         bindings management task queue

instance.description:
Instance Identifier
         * 0        : chassis-wide TDP Identifier
         * non-zero : Not chassis-wide TDP Identifier (i.e,for a ATM interface)

flags.description:
Flag value,
         0x01 : Request bindings marking
         0x02 : Request bindings update if a new LDP ID is being used
         0x04 : Request bindings deletion

         0x01 : Request bindings marking
         0x02 : Request bindings update if a new LDP ID is being used
         0x04 : Request bindings deletion

igp-sync-hold-down-time.description: IGP sync hold down time in seconds

disc-num-ldp-intf.description: Number of interfaces LDP is configured

disc-num-ldp-intf-active.description: Number of interfaces LDP is enabled

disc-num-bad-src-addr.description: Number of LDP errors with Bad Source address

disc-num-bad-hello-pdu.description: Number of LDP errors with Bad Hello PDUs

disc-num-bad-xport-addr.description: Number of LDP errors with Bad Transport address

disc-num-same-router-id.description: Number of LDP errors with same router id

disc-num-wrong-router-id.description: Number of LDP errors with wrong router id
